name: Docent (Combat Morph)
entries: To attune to a docent, you must embed the item somewhere on your body, such as your chest or your eye socket.
This docent can be merged onto a second docent, allowing the owner to switch between any possible morphs with an action.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: A docent is a sentient item of any alignment with an Intelligence of 16, a Wisdom of 14, and a Charisma of 14. It perceives the world through your senses. It communicates telepathically with you and can speak, read, and understand any language it knows (see "Random Properties" below).

entries.name: Combat Support
entries: Whenever you end your turn without making use of the docent’s abilities your AC is increased by 1 until the start of your next turn, in addition it has several random abilities.

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: A docent has the following properties:

{@b Damage Types}. Damage Types. As a bonus action, the docent can fire a beam of energy of either fire or radiant, as well as {@dice 1d4} additional damage types: (1) cold, (2) acid, (3) thunder, (4) force. This beam uses your spell casting bonus (if you have one) or your Intelligence + proficiency. On hit it deals {@dice 1d10}+1 of your chosen damage type.

{@b Skills}. As a bonus action, the docent can Help you with one of the skills it knows. It knows up two skills (roll a {@dice d4}): (1) {@skill Athletics}, (2) {@skill Acrobatics}, (3) {@skill Stealth}, or (4) {@skill Perception}.

{@b Spells}. The docent knows up two of the following spells and can cast each once per long rest, requiring no components (roll a {@dice 2d6}): (1–2) {@spell hellish rebuke}, (3–4) {@spell shield} or (5–6) {@spell absorb elements}. The docent can cast the spell without requiring your reaction.

entries.name: Personality
entries: A docent is designed to advise and assist the warforged it's attached to. One of the simple functions of a docent is to serve as a translator. The docent's properties are under its control, and if you have a bad relationship with your docent, it might refuse to assist you.
